title: Omega Squad 2017 login

I agree. As a solid splash it looks great! but as a animated login, it actually hurts my head to look at (I am incredibly prone to migraines). Something about the layering and I don't even know what's going on between Trist, Viegar, and Twitch... it took me a little bit of searching to figure out what the tail was ('why is there a knife on a rope...? oh, it's twitch's tail'). 

Also the tilt of the poster/login anims actually pulls VERY HEAVY to the lower left. It feels like it's about to slide apart, and my eyes can't find anything on that far side to really look at.

My eyes first hit trist, then twitch. After that, they get lost on the far left. I can't really appreciate the right half simply because my eyes can't complete a full rotation of the picture without having to force it. 

TL;DR: It is a good piece..... but it needs a little bit of work on layering, weight, and movement.

Thanks for listening!

"The Rock" is a little different in what it says musically. This is more a nod towards David Arnold, Alan Silvestri and Basil Poledouris (at least as far as the orchestral stuff is concerned), and the great work they've produced in the 90ies. 

The synth stuff is a mixed bag: there's some Miami Vice vibes in there, some more modern things as well. 

That said, from a mix standpoint the overall sound of the piece is closer to Zimmerland than it is to the work of the composers I referenced above. 

Cheers!
